law.catch_line: Determination Of Record Date Of Right To Notice Of And To Vote At Stockholdersâ€™ Meeting
law.text: The directors may fix in advance a time, which, unless a shorter period is provided in the by-laws, shall be not more than sixty days before the date of any meeting of the stockholders or the date for the payment of any dividend or the making of any distribution to stockholders or the last day on which the consent or dissent of stockholders may be effectively expressed for any purpose, as the record date for determining the stockholders having the right to notice of and to vote at such meeting and any adjournment thereof or the right to receive such dividend or distribution or the right to give such consent or dissent, and in such case only stockholders of record on such record date shall have such right, notwithstanding any transfer of stock on the books of the corporation after the record date; or without fixing such record date the directors may for any of such purposes close the transfer books for all or any part of such period.
